definitions: measurement of how tall something is from base to top
most intense or successful period of something
examples: The height of the building exceeds fifty meters
She measured her height against the wall
His career reached its height during the nineties
The storm was at its height around midnight

definitions: distinct period or stage in a process of change or development
examples: The project is entering its final phase next month
Adolescence is a difficult phase for many teenagers

definitions: person who is averse to change and holds traditional values
examples: Many conservatives oppose the proposed education reforms
Her grandfather was a conservative who valued old customs

definitions: expression of disapproval based on perceived faults or mistakes
detailed analysis and assessment of something, especially literary or artistic work
examples: The proposal faced heavy criticism from environmental groups
She doesn't handle criticism of her work very well
His literary criticism appears in several academic journals
The film received mixed criticism from professional reviewers

definitions: teaching staff of a university or college department
inherent mental or physical power or capability
examples: The faculty voted to approve the new curriculum
She joined the faculty after completing her doctorate
He retained all his mental faculties until the end
The faculty of speech distinguishes humans from animals

definitions: something done successfully through effort, skill, or courage
examples: Winning the championship was her greatest achievement
The school celebrates student achievements at year end

definitions: colorless volatile liquid that is the intoxicating constituent of wine, beer, and spirits
examples: The restaurant doesn't serve alcohol on Sundays
Alcohol consumption increases during the holiday season

definitions: treatment intended to relieve or heal a disorder
examples: She attends therapy sessions twice a week
Physical therapy helped him recover from the injury

definitions: breach of law or rule; an illegal act
team or players in possession of the ball attempting to score
examples: Drunk driving is a serious offense in most states
He was charged with a federal offense
The team's offense scored three touchdowns today
They need to improve their offense next season

definitions: act of touching someone or something physically
small amount or trace of something
examples: The gentle touch of her hand was comforting
The surface is sensitive to the slightest touch
Add just a touch of salt to the soup
There was a touch of sadness in her voice

definitions: person or animal that kills another living creature
something that causes death or is extremely difficult
examples: Police are searching for the killer of two women
The documentary examines the mind of serial killers
That final exam was a real killer
Heart disease remains the number one killer worldwide

definitions: combination of characteristics that form an individual's distinctive character
celebrity or person of prominence in a particular field
examples: Her outgoing personality makes her popular with colleagues
The test measures different aspects of personality
Several television personalities attended the charity event
He became a well-known personality in local politics

definitions: all visible features of an area of countryside or land
distinctive features of a particular situation or field
examples: The landscape changed from forest to open plains
She photographs landscapes in the American Southwest
The political landscape has shifted dramatically this year
Technology is transforming the educational landscape

definitions: process or period of changing from one state or condition to another
examples: The transition from high school to college can be challenging
The country is in transition to a market economy

definitions: upright pillar typically cylindrical and made of stone or concrete
regular article or feature in a newspaper or magazine
examples: The ancient temple was supported by marble columns
They added decorative columns to the front porch
She writes a weekly column for the local newspaper
His advice column appears every Sunday morning

definitions: small disc or knob sewn onto garment for fastening
device pressed to operate a machine or electrical mechanism
examples: She sewed new buttons on her winter coat
One button was missing from his shirt
Press the red button to start the machine
The elevator button for the third floor wasn't working

definitions: someone who competes against or fights another in a contest, game, or argument
examples: She defeated her opponent in straight sets
Political opponents criticized the mayor's new policy

definitions: person who comes to live permanently in a foreign country
examples: Her grandparents were immigrants from Italy
The city has a large immigrant population

definitions: action of sharing something out among a number of recipients
way in which something is spread over an area
examples: The distribution of food supplies began immediately
They handle distribution for several major publishers
Scientists studied the distribution of wildlife in the region
The map shows the distribution of rainfall

definitions: game played on large course where players hit small ball into holes using clubs
examples: He plays golf every Saturday morning
The golf tournament attracted players from around the world

definitions: one or more things available as another possibility or choice
examples: We need to find an alternative to fossil fuels
The alternative route takes twenty minutes longer

definitions: person or thing regarded with special favor or preference
examples: Chocolate ice cream is my favorite dessert
She's the favorite to win the championship

definitions: place designated for a train or bus to pick up passengers
act of ceasing movement or operation
examples: The bus stop is just around the corner
We made several stops during our road trip
The sudden stop threw everyone forward
The referee called for a stop in play

definitions: part or share of a whole, especially when allocated to someone
examples: Each child received an equal portion of cake
A large portion of the budget goes to healthcare

definitions: act of intentionally causing one's own death
examples: The organization works to prevent teen suicide
Suicide rates have increased during the pandemic

definitions: amount by which something, especially money, is too small or falls short
examples: The company reported a deficit of two million dollars
The trade deficit continues to grow each year

definitions: physical or mental feature indicating disease or condition
sign of the existence of something undesirable
examples: Fever is a common symptom of infection
The patient reported several unusual symptoms
Rising crime rates are a symptom of deeper social problems
These failures are symptoms of poor management

definitions: statement expressing dissatisfaction or annoyance about something
formal allegation or charge against a party
examples: Customer complaints have increased this month
She lodged a complaint about the noise
The lawyer filed a complaint with the court
The complaint alleges breach of contract

definitions: person who approves of and encourages someone or something
examples: The candidate thanked her supporters after the victory
He's been a loyal supporter of the team for years

definitions: study of fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence
theory or attitude that guides one's behavior
examples: She studied philosophy at university
Ancient Greek philosophy influenced Western thought
His philosophy of life is to help others
The company's philosophy emphasizes customer satisfaction

definitions: period of being a child, from birth to puberty
examples: She spent her childhood in a small rural town
Childhood memories often shape our adult lives

definitions: deep hole dug to obtain water, oil, or gas
shaft sunk into ground to obtain water from underground
examples: They drilled a well to find fresh water
The old well had been covered for safety
The oil well produced thousands of barrels daily
Workers dug the well fifty feet deep

definitions: absence of light, especially because it is night
examples: She's afraid to walk alone in the dark
The power outage left us in complete dark

definitions: abundance of valuable possessions, property, or money
examples: His wealth came from successful business investments
The nation's wealth depends on natural resources

definitions: health, happiness, and fortunes of a person or group
financial support given to people in need by government
examples: The new policy promotes child welfare
Animal welfare organizations protested the conditions
Many families depend on welfare during economic downturns
The welfare system underwent major reforms

definitions: state of being extremely poor and lacking basic necessities
examples: Millions of children live in poverty worldwide
The charity works to alleviate poverty in rural areas

definitions: legal official who conducts criminal proceedings against someone
examples: The prosecutor presented evidence to the jury
She worked as a federal prosecutor for ten years

definitions: period of time worked by group of workers
slight change in position, direction, or tendency
examples: She works the night shift at the hospital
The factory operates in three eight-hour shifts
There's been a shift in public opinion recently
The wind shift changed the fire's direction

definitions: informal term for dollar in American currency
adult male deer, antelope, or rabbit
examples: The coffee costs three bucks
Can you lend me twenty bucks?
The hunter spotted a large buck in the clearing
A young buck jumped across the trail

definitions: arrangement of objects or information for public viewing
electronic device for visual presentation of data
examples: The museum's display of ancient artifacts impressed visitors
The store window display attracted many customers
The computer display needs to be adjusted
Modern phones have high-resolution displays

definitions: instrument with blade and handle used for cutting or as weapon
examples: She used a sharp knife to slice the vegetables
The chef's knife collection was very expensive

definitions: shape like a circle or curved like part of circle
regular sequence of activities or functions
examples: The table has a round top
Children sat in a round circle
The doctor is doing her morning rounds
This is the final round of negotiations

definitions: informal term for technology or technical matters
examples: She works in tech at a startup company
The tech industry continues to grow rapidly

definitions: person, especially police officer, whose job is investigating crimes
examples: The detective questioned witnesses about the robbery
Private detectives often work on missing person cases

definitions: state of confusion or untidiness
disruption of normal physical or mental functions
examples: The room was in complete disorder after the party
Public disorder broke out after the announcement
She was diagnosed with an anxiety disorder
Sleep disorders affect millions of people

definitions: animal, as distinct from a human being
examples: Strange creatures live in the deep ocean
The forest is home to many nocturnal creatures

definitions: buildings or accommodations in which people live collectively
examples: The city needs more affordable housing
Student housing is located near the campus

definitions: small clock worn on wrist or carried in pocket
examples: She glanced at her watch to check the time
His gold watch was a graduation gift

definitions: small piece broken off from larger object
tiny wafer of semiconducting material used in electronics
examples: A chip of paint fell from the old wall
She found chips of glass on the floor
The computer chip controls all the device's functions
Modern cars contain dozens of specialized chips

definitions: strip of material worn around neck under shirt collar
result in game or competition where two sides have same score
examples: He wore a red tie to the interview
The dress code requires a suit and tie
The game ended in a tie score
They need to break the tie with overtime
